00.orig_text: Apple unveils iPhone 4, iOS 4 at Worldwide Developers Conference 2010
00.text: Apple unveils iPhone 4, iOS 4 at Worldwide Developers Conference 2010

02.orig_text: Yesterday, at this year's Apple Worldwide Developers Conference (WWDC), company CEO Steve Jobs unveiled iPhone 4, along with the new iOS 4 operating system for Apple mobile devices.
02.text: Yesterday, at this year's Apple Worldwide Developers Conference (WWDC), company CEO Steve Jobs unveiled iPhone 4, along with the new iOS 4 operating system for Apple mobile devices.

03.orig_text: The announcement was long-awaited but not a very big surprise.
03.text: The announcement was long-awaited but not a very big surprise.

04.orig_text: In April, the technology blog Gizmodo obtained a prototype of the new phone and published details of it online.
04.text: In April, the technology blog Gizmodo obtained a prototype of the new phone and published details of it online.

05.orig_text: While introducing iPhone 4, at the annual conference, Jobs started by hinting at the incident, saying, ``Stop me if you've already seen this.``
05.text: While introducing iPhone 4, at the annual conference, Jobs started by hinting at the incident, saying, ``Stop me if you've already seen this.``

06.orig_text: The new iPhone was praised by Jobs as ``the biggest leap we've taken since the original iPhone.``
06.text: The new iPhone was praised by Jobs as ``the biggest leap we've taken since the original iPhone.``

07.orig_text: It is only 9.3 millimetres (0.37 inches) thick, making it ``the thinnest smartphone on the planet``, a 24 percent reduction from Apple's previous model, the iPhone 3GS.
07.text: It is only 9.3 millimetres (0.37 inches) thick, making it ``the thinnest smartphone on the planet``, a 24 percent reduction from Apple's previous model, the iPhone 3GS.

08.orig_text: Structure-wise, iPhone 4 has a new stainless steel frame, which acts as an antenna, supposedly boosting its signal reception abilities and possibly reducing the amount of dropped calls.
08.text: Structure-wise, iPhone 4 has a new stainless steel frame, which acts as an antenna, supposedly boosting its signal reception abilities and possibly reducing the amount of dropped calls.

09.orig_text: It also has a new screen, dubbed a ``retina display,`` which displays images at 326 pixels per inch.
09.text: It also has a new screen, dubbed a ``retina display,`` which displays images at 326 pixels per inch.

10.orig_text: During the keynote, Jobs demoed the device's new internal gyroscope as well.
10.text: During the keynote, Jobs demoed the device's new internal gyroscope as well.

11.orig_text: Even though it now uses Apple's faster A4 processor (first used in its iPad tablet), iPhone 4 has a claimed seven hours of 3G talk time, up two hours from the 3GS.
11.text: Even though it now uses Apple's faster A4 processor (first used in its iPad tablet), iPhone 4 has a claimed seven hours of 3G talk time, up two hours from the 3GS.

12.orig_text: In addition to its design features, Jobs showed off iPhone 4's new video calling abilities.
12.text: In addition to its design features, Jobs showed off iPhone 4's new video calling abilities.

13.orig_text: This feature is called FaceTime, and connects with other iPhone 4s via Wi-Fi.
13.text: This feature is called FaceTime, and connects with other iPhone 4s via Wi-Fi.

14.orig_text: The phone has two cameras: one on the front for video chats, and one on the back for taking pictures and other videos.
14.text: The phone has two cameras: one on the front for video chats, and one on the back for taking pictures and other videos.

15.orig_text: The rear camera has a resolution of five megapixels, is capable of recording high-definition video, and has an LED flash.
15.text: The rear camera has a resolution of five megapixels, is capable of recording high-definition video, and has an LED flash.

16.orig_text: The iPhone 4 will use Apple's latest mobile operating system, iOS 4.
16.text: The iPhone 4 will use Apple's latest mobile operating system, iOS 4.

17.orig_text: Formerly ``iPhone OS,`` iOS 4 was first introduced by Apple in April, and includes multitasking capabilities.
17.text: Formerly ``iPhone OS,`` iOS 4 was first introduced by Apple in April, and includes multitasking capabilities.

18.orig_text: Jobs called the new software ``the most advanced mobile operating system in the world.``
18.text: Jobs called the new software ``the most advanced mobile operating system in the world.``

19.orig_text: iOS will support Apple's new mobile advertising service, iAd, which goes live on July 1.
19.text: iOS will support Apple's new mobile advertising service, iAd, which goes live on July 1.

20.orig_text: iPhone 4 will be available on June 24 in the United States, United Kingdom, France, Germany, and Japan.
20.text: iPhone 4 will be available on June 24 in the United States, United Kingdom, France, Germany, and Japan.

21.orig_text: It comes in two colors--black and white--and two storage capacities.
21.text: It comes in two colors--black and white--and two storage capacities.

22.orig_text: The 16GB version is priced at US$199 and the 32GB version at US$299.
22.text: The 16GB version is priced at US$199 and the 32GB version at US$299.

23.orig_text: The iPhone 3GS's price will be reduced to US$99, and the iPhone 3G will be discontinued.
23.text: The iPhone 3GS's price will be reduced to US$99, and the iPhone 3G will be discontinued.

24.orig_text: iOS will be available as a free software update to users of compatible older Apple devices (including the 3GS) on June 21.
24.text: iOS will be available as a free software update to users of compatible older Apple devices (including the 3GS) on June 21.

25.orig_text: In the U.S., iPhone 4 will only be available on AT&T's cellular network, despite calls for Apple to let the iPhone be used on other carriers, such as Verizon.
25.text: In the U.S., iPhone 4 will only be available on AT&T's cellular network, despite calls for Apple to let the iPhone be used on other carriers, such as Verizon.

26.orig_text: Competition-wise, the BlackBerry mobile device is still the most popular smartphone right now.
26.text: Competition-wise, the BlackBerry mobile device is still the most popular smartphone right now.

27.orig_text: Apple is also facing some serious competition from web giant Google's Android operating system, as well as Palm's webOS.
27.text: Apple is also facing some serious competition from web giant Google's Android operating system, as well as Palm's webOS.

28.orig_text: Earlier this year, Android phones managed to outsell iPhones.
28.text: Earlier this year, Android phones managed to outsell iPhones.

29.orig_text: iPhone users, however, account for over half of those surfing the Internet on a mobile browser in the U.S. Jobs also noted that over five billion iOS applications, commonly called ``apps,`` have been purchased from Apple's App Store.
29.text: iPhone users, however, account for over half of those surfing the Internet on a mobile browser in the U.S. Jobs also noted that over five billion iOS applications, commonly called ``apps,`` have been purchased from Apple's App Store.

30.orig_text: The App Store currently has around 225,000 different apps for sale.
30.text: The App Store currently has around 225,000 different apps for sale.

M238.text: the thinnest smartphone on the planet
